images.copyright: Composite photo showing the phases of the moon (© Delpixart/Getty Images)
images.title: One giant leap for mankind
images.caption: National Moon Day
images.desc: Bigger and brighter than anything else you can see from Earth in the night sky, the moon has inspired our calendar, our songs, our art, our stories, and our dreams. Today, on National Moon Day, we remember one dream that came true on this date in 1969: the day humans first set foot on the lunar surface. So far, it's the only place beyond our planet that humans have visited.
